entry.title: ranchos of Los Angeles County (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that grantees of ranchos of Los Angeles County submitted hand-drawn maps known as diseños (example pictured) when making their land claims to the U.S. government?

entry.title: al-Amir bi-Ahkam Allah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that medieval Muslim historians blamed al-Amir bi-Ahkam Allah for the loss of much of Palestine to the crusaders but, in reality, he played no role in the Fatimid government during that period?

entry.title: Tropical Snow (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tim Allen debuted in the 1988 film Tropical Snow?

entry.title: Cathy Whims (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cathy Whims has opened several restaurants in Portland, Oregon, including the Nostrana, which has been described as "Portland's capital of the Negroni"?

entry.title: Capa House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at Capa House, photographer Robert Capa captured The Picture of the Last Man to Die, of American soldier Raymond J. Bowman?

entry.title: his performance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Michalis Rakintzis said that he "came close to throwing down [his] microphone and walking off the stage" during his performance at the Eurovision Song Contest 2002?

entry.title: Tina Hutchinson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in her first year with San Diego State, basketball player Tina Hutchinson set NCAA freshman scoring records and led the Aztecs to their first NCAA tournament?

entry.title: Jean Mignon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that most figures in 16th-century etchings by Jean Mignon have open mouths?
